experience.description_html:
JOB PURPOSE

1. Support the Head in generating sales leads and securing new clients through meetings and pitches.

2. Procure, manage, and execute revenue-generating events.

3. Stay updated on market trends, customer demands, and competitors.

4. Identify client needs and provide tailored solutions.

5. Plan and implement sales strategies while monitoring advertising and competitor campaigns.

6. Collaborate with the team to develop new revenue streams.

7. Undertake ad-hoc projects assigned by management.

KEY ACTIVITIES

1. Sales and Ideation
- Lead the Event & Sales unit, identifying prospects for events.
- Drive sales through proactive and reactive strategies.
- Research, negotiate, and close deals while advising clients.
- Develop creative event concepts and oversee execution.

2. Revenue Management & Business Development
- Work to achieve revenue targets and manage budgets.
- Maximise revenue through up-selling and accurate forecasting.
- Assist in developing new revenue streams.

3. Event Management
- Oversee event planning, sales, budgeting, and execution.
- Ensure smooth on-site event operations.

4. Process & Operational Management
- Develop and manage sales strategies, timelines, budgets, and staffing.
- Ensure seamless coordination between sales and operations.
- Manage administrative tasks for efficient project execution.

5. Customer Service
- Understand event projects, features, and target customers.
- Ensure compliance with customer fulfilment processes.

This role requires sales expertise, strategic planning, and project management skills to drive revenue growth and client satisfaction.

experience.title: Senior Executive
experience.description: In my role overseeing student affairs, I’ve developed a diverse skill set that includes:Event Planning and Management:Organizing a wide range of student events, from large-scale activities like the Spectrum of Hope Autism Awareness Run, Merdeka Fun Run, and Gala Night to cultural celebrations and team-building exercises.Leadership and Team Collaboration:Leading and facilitating the Student Ambassador Programme, Student Council, and student leaders’ team-building activities, while also collaborating with department heads, lecturers, and external stakeholders to ensure seamless execution of initiatives.Student Welfare and Support:Managing student welfare, international visa applications, and overseeing the well-being of both local and international students, demonstrating strong interpersonal and problem-solving skills.Customer Service Experience:Providing front-line support to students and parents, addressing inquiries and resolving concerns related to student affairs, demonstrating a customer-focused approach, patience, and empathy.Communication and Public Speaking:Serving as the College’s official emcee for internal and external events, including moderating the Program Kepolisan Komuniti, showcasing excellent communication, presentation, and moderation skills.Sustainable Development:Driving initiatives aligned with the United Nations’ Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), reflecting my commitment to sustainability and community impact.Creative Design and Content Creation:Designing posters and creating videos for various college events and initiatives, highlighting my proficiency in creative tools and digital content development.
experience.description_html:
In my role overseeing student affairs, I’ve developed a diverse skill set that includes:

Event Planning and Management:
Organizing a wide range of student events, from large-scale activities like the Spectrum of Hope Autism Awareness Run, Merdeka Fun Run, and Gala Night to cultural celebrations and team-building exercises.

Leadership and Team Collaboration:
Leading and facilitating the Student Ambassador Programme, Student Council, and student leaders’ team-building activities, while also collaborating with department heads, lecturers, and external stakeholders to ensure seamless execution of initiatives.

Student Welfare and Support:
Managing student welfare, international visa applications, and overseeing the well-being of both local and international students, demonstrating strong interpersonal and problem-solving skills.

Customer Service Experience:
Providing front-line support to students and parents, addressing inquiries and resolving concerns related to student affairs, demonstrating a customer-focused approach, patience, and empathy.

Communication and Public Speaking:
Serving as the College’s official emcee for internal and external events, including moderating the Program Kepolisan Komuniti, showcasing excellent communication, presentation, and moderation skills.

Sustainable Development:
Driving initiatives aligned with the United Nations’ Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), reflecting my commitment to sustainability and community impact.

Creative Design and Content Creation:
Designing posters and creating videos for various college events and initiatives, highlighting my proficiency in creative tools and digital content development.

name: Jeff Steele
full_about:
Dynamic, enthusiastic, hard driving consultative sales and business development executive with over 20 years of account development, program management, and leadership roles in start-up and expansion organizations seeks opportunity to grow revenues, increase profits, take market share, and set new standards and benchmarks for others to challenge and be measured against. 

Pioneered the sale of small cells, pico and femto, to T-Mobile USA, Cincinnati Bell Wireless, AT&T Mobility, and (OEM) Cisco for ip.access resulting in North America organization leading the world in sales at $20M+ after 4 years. Globally managed Nortel Account ($130M OEM) for Spectrian/REMEC. Successfully spearheaded aftermarket amplifier sales program to carriers and led the company in aftermarket base station and tower mounted amplifier sales, engineering, integration, and optimization services. Gained market share with significant sales to major carriers including Verizon, Cingular, AT&T Wireless, Sprint PCS, and Alamosa PCS.

Specialties: Creative self-starter and strategic thinker responsible for penetrating accounts, building relationships, evaluating customer needs, qualifying products, exposing applications, initiating field trials, negotiating supplier agreements, forecasting, and obtaining orders. Quota driven and performance oriented. Consummate team player.

full_about:
I am a proactive and resourceful professional with a background in executive support, project management, and community engagement. With years of experience navigating dynamic roles across diverse industries, I have developed expertise in logistics management, fostering connections, and leading multifaceted projects.

As the Director of Community Engagement at Howdy.com, I lead efforts to strengthen relationships within our network by attending networking events, hosting meetups, and organizing socials that bring together senior-level professionals. My role includes curating and hosting internal events that enhance collaboration and community within Howdy’s ecosystem.

Previously, as an Executive Assistant, I supported C-level executives by managing intricate schedules, coordinating travel, overseeing HR onboarding, and organizing events that enhanced company culture. My efforts extended to property management, vendor coordination, and leading a professional development program for engineers in Latin America.

Earlier in my career, I excelled as a Product Specialist and Inside Sales Representative, leveraging strong communication skills to build meaningful client relationships and drive business growth. Fluent in Spanish, adept at conflict resolution, and proficient in tools like Salesforce, Zoho CRM, and Google Suite, I consistently deliver results in fast-paced, goal-driven environments.

Driven by a passion for fostering connections and ensuring operational excellence, I am eager to bring my adaptable and detail-oriented approach to initiatives that create meaningful impact.

name: Zafar Kahn
city: New York, New York, United States
full_about:
Based out of New York, Zafar is the CEO and Founder of Growthster™ and AvantaHub™, a seasoned growth marketer, go-to-market expert, serial entrepreneur, and revenue operations executive. He helps companies spring into hypergrowth by offering best practices across marketing automation, social media, demand generation, campaign management, business process automation, and digital strategy.

Originally from Upstate New York, Zafar’s entrepreneurial spirit flourished in New York City. Cutting his teeth at digital marketing startups in the early 2000s, he’s hustled hard to become a familiar and trusted face in the field. After noticing a crater-sized gap in the industry’s approach (there were no real-world results), Zafar founded and currently runs a hypergrowth studio headquartered in Upstate NY and Boston. 

Composed of a global and remote workforce of expert digital marketers, SEOs, copywriters, automation experts, designers, SDRs, and growth hackers, Growthster delivers big results for its clients.

Zafar enjoys identifying gaps and implementing operational efficiencies that bring key metrics and insights to the foreground, allowing smart, well-informed business decisions to be made.

A true and abiding student, he’s lent his foresight and expertise to hundreds of emerging companies looking to scale quickly by dispensing cutting-edge tactics and wisdom gained from his 20+ years of experience in digital marketing.

An abounding passion for digital marketing is evident in every interaction with Zafar. 

Trust him to connect the dots in your RevOps and offer a torrent of analytical insight.

Areas of Expertise:

· Database Marketing
· Global Sales Management
· Business Process Automation
· Audience Segmentation
· Workflow Automation
· Tactical Execution
· Business Development & Growth Strategy
· Remarketing
· Revenue Operations
· Performance Marketing
· Influencer Marketing
· Enterprise Solution Selling
· Integrated Sales & Marketing
· Account-Based Sales Development Strategy
· Client Facing / New Business & Account Growth
· Team Leadership & Talent Development
· Sales Enablement, Processes, Infrastructure & Systems
· Sales and Marketing Operations | Revenue Marketing Operations
· Sales Acceleration Tools Stack Strategy and Implementation
· Data Sourcing & Competitive/Sales Intelligence
· KPI Benchmarking & Sales Reporting

(Fuel Consumption and voyage report)  for the head office financial calculation.16.Assist Chief Engineer and Master(Captain) in some officeoffice jobs especially SAP S4HANA operation such as Work Order Report.17.Monthly physical inventory and report for (Lube Oils, Paints, Chemicals).18.Serve as vessels Admin/Secretary.
experience.description_html:
1.Maintain stocks in and out of store room.
2.Inventory control for Critical and non-critical Machineries and Equipments.
3.Serve as the custodian of ships manuals, certificates, and vessels drawing plan.
4.SAP S4HANA operator (ERP) creates Purchase Requisitions as per Department head advise and approval. The Head Office Purchasing team deals with RFQ and the sent back on-board the RFQ and I’ll be the one to handle the evaluation of the RFQ.
5.After RFQ is submitted and verified, the Purchase Order will be generated by the Purchasing team from the Head Office and my job is to cross-check base from the issued Purchase requisition on-board.
6.Filing of Purchase Request and Purchase Orders also Delivery Invoices received.
7.Creates Service Order for outbound technician to be on-board for service repairs and for dry-dock.
8.Creates Offloading/landing Order for spare parts or equipment to be repair offshore.
9.Register in the database about materials/items that is not available in SAP S4HANA using the SAP FIORI.
10.Received items and verifying that the items are correct and the quantity is correct are per delivery invoice.
11.Once items are received and verified, labels the items and store them to their dedicated store room.
12.Generating GRN (good receipt number) through SAP S4HANA for the delivery invoice receipt/received onboard.
13.Manage in/out of stocks in the SAP S4HANA to have an accurate stock count via application and physically.
14.Conducts training for the (Engineers and Navigational Officers) through SAP S4HANA. This is for the reporting of Work orders or their respective accounts.
15.Generates Daily noon reports for Chief Engr. (Fuel Consumption and voyage report) for the head office financial calculation.
16.Assist Chief Engineer and Master(Captain) in some officeoffice jobs especially SAP S4HANA operation such as Work Order Report.
17.Monthly physical inventory and report for (Lube Oils, Paints, Chemicals).
18.Serve as vessels Admin/Secretary.

experience.description_html:
1.Ensure that the stocks meets the minimum and maximum level and maintain accurate inventory.
2.Filing of ships manuals, certificates, and vessels drawing plan other ships reports.
3.Used PRIORITY system in issuing purchase requisitions. (ERP software for Purchase Requisition, verifying Purchase Order and closing of delivery Invoice).
4.Deals with the Purchasing Manager and logistic team in head office through MS Outlook with regards to issued purchase requisitions on-board then after review the RFQ sent by the office.
5.Receiving, verifying that the items are correct base from the delivery invoice. Then refer the invoice to the Purchase Requisition and Purchase Order no. Once items are verified, label the items and stores them to their respective store room.
6.If items received is incorrect, informs Chief Engr. for verification and then with the office approval head office. Once the office approved, then I prepare/creates landing order and pack the item and arrange with the vessel agent to properly send the item offshore to proper address.
7.Generates monthly physical inventory report for (Lube Oil, chemicals, Paints Consumption and generate report and calculation thru MS Excel) for the office financial calculation.
